Question: What should you do if an ambulance comes up behind you, flashing red lights or sounding its siren?

Answers.Answer: Put your vehicle hazard lights on and drive on at the same speed
Slow down, pull over and allow the ambulance to pass
Flash your vehicle headlights to warn oncoming traffic

Question: What must you do if you intend to move your vehicle from the right-hand lane to the left-hand lane?

Answers.Answer: Move to the left as quickly as possible
Speed up and signal as you move to the left
Signal for at least 3 seconds before moving left
Slow down and signal as you move to the left

Question: What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
A broken yellow line painted close to the edge of the road means you may stop or park your vehicle there at any time.
What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may stop for no more than 5 minutes

Question: What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Question: You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

Question: If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: What is the recommended distance you should allow when driving past a cyclist?
If you have a rear tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: When driving on a road with lanes you must be able to stop in half the length of clear road you can see in front of you.
You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?
If you can do so safely, you may pass on the left at an intersection if:

Answers.Answer: you have the headlights of your vehicle turned on
the vehicle in front is signalling a left turn
the vehicle in front is signalling a right turn
the vehicle in front is going faster than the speed limit

Question: What does a reflectorised triangle placed on the side of the road mean?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

Question: If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?
Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: You wish to make a right turn on a narrow country road. There is a vehicle coming towards you and traffic behind you. What is the safest option?

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
Decide not to turn and drive straight ahead
Move to the left side of the road and turn when the road is clear

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top right corner of the windscreen

Question: You are driving on a road with marked lanes and you are in the lane with an arrow showing a left turn only. What must you do?
You are driving on a country road at night when your vehicle headlights suddenly go out. What is the safest thing to do?

Answers.Answer: Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle hazard lights on
Slow down and drive on the far left side of the road
Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle’s interior lights on
Slow down, move off the road gradually, stop and turn your vehicle hazard lights on

Question: Who can require you to undergo a breath screening test?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle
